definition: to accompany one's child or spouse who is studying overseas/to help a child with their study, reading or practicing together
to accompany/to keep sb company/to assist/old variant of 賠|赔[pei2]
comma/phrase marked by pause
to read/to study/reading of word (i.e. pronunciation), similar to 拼音[pin1 yin1]

sentences.english: The tower pulled false princely Sang Jie accompany read slave, two people are like brother in person.
sentences.chinese: 塔拉成了假王子桑傑的陪讀奴隸，兩個人親如兄弟。

sentences.english: Schools do not invite students' family members to accompany them to study.
sentences.chinese: 學校不邀請留學生家屬來校陪讀。

sentences.english: Family members accompanying students shall apply for L visa only.
sentences.chinese: 外國留學生的陪讀家屬，應作爲探親者申請L簽證。

sentences.english: Do you need a tutor or a friend for your child?
sentences.chinese: 您的孩子需要家教或全程陪讀嗎？

sentences.english: I'm writing to discuss about whether our parents should accompany us studying at school.
sentences.chinese: 我想討論關於“父母有沒有必要陪讀”這個問題。

sentences.english: Should Parents Keep Their Children Accompany In School?
Accompanying us studying school can let us have more time to spare for our studies.
sentences.chinese: 父母陪讀可以讓我們有更充裕時間，投入到學習當中。

definition: to attend school as a day student
student of a senior high school
medical school
excelling both in morals and studies (idiom); top marks for studies and for behavior (at school)/a paragon of virtue and learning
force feeding (as a teaching method)
proficiency in a particular field (idiom)/skill in a specialized area (idiom)
not to engage in honest work/to ignore one's proper occupation/not to attend to one's proper duties
professional/advanced/senior
to change schools/to transfer to another college
teaching and administrative staff
to attend to the needs of (an invalid, disabled person etc)/caregiver
stepfather
social work
to play truant/to cut classes
to jump a year (at college)
boarding school
